definitions.definition: To restore to a former place , position, condition, etc.; to put back .
examples: When you've finished using the telephone, please replace the handset.

definitions.definition: To refund ; to repay ; to pay back .
examples: You can take what you need from the petty cash, but you must replace it tomorrow morning.

definitions.definition: To supply or substitute an equivalent with.
examples: I replaced my car with a newer model.
The batteries were dead so I replaced them.

definitions.definition: To take over the position or role from.
To take the place of; to be used instead of.
examples: This security pass replaces the one you were given earlier.

definitions.definition: To demolish (a building) and build an updated form of that building in its place.
To put in a new or different place.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To restore to a former place , position, condition, etc.; to put back .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To refund ; to repay ; to pay back .
( transitive ) To supply or substitute an equivalent with.
( transitive ) To take over the position or role from.
( transitive ) To take the place of; to be used instead of.
( transitive ) To demolish (a building) and build an updated form of that building in its place.
( transitive , rare ) To put in a new or different place.
